bioghist.p: Prior to 1913 the City of Philadelphia's relations with public transit companies were administered through the offices of the City Surveyor and the Bureau of Highways under the general supervision of Councils' Committee on Street Railroads. In that year, under an Act approved on 9 May 1913, the Department of City Transit was established to coordinate the control of all transit facilities located within the City with especial regard to the contract of 1907 between the City and the Philadelphia Rapid Transit Company formed in that year as an amalgamation of the many transit companies that had existed independently until that time.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists largely of printed materials created by Philadelphia Rapid Transit (PRT), which in 1940 became the Philadelphia Transportation Company (PTC), with some later materials from SEPTA, into which PTC merged in 1968. Additionally, there are some original company records, including accident reports, scattered employee records, photographs, and a handful of office files. There is also a small amount of correspondence and several publications of the Metropolitan Philadelphia Railway Association. Materials in the collection include: PTC Annual Reports, 1903-1969 (lacking 1939 and 1968); Rules and Instructions for Transportation employees, 1924, 1925, 1944, 1949, 1953; PTC Agreements with the Transportation Workers Union of America, 1944, 1945, 1947, 1950, and with the PRT Employees' Union, 1944; Department of City Transit Contracts, 1924-1931; plans and revised plans of reorganization, 1934-1938; notices to Stockholders relating to reorganizations, 1938 & 1966; PTC Accident Registers for 1952, 1953, and 1954; PRT Traffic Survey of 1923; operations manuals, rules for employees, and other publications and forms for employees. Office files in the collection include reports, notices of fare changes, student exams, employee records, accident reports on the trolley lines, forms, and "spook reports," which documented employee misbehavior as observed by company spies. Other materials include: a copy of an agreement between PTC and SEPTA, 1968; by-laws; agreements and leases; traction programs; reports; programs for the annual company picnic at Willow Grove Park, photographs; telephone directories; public notices (many oversized); some blueprints; promotional publications of the PTC; and 16 binders of transfer coupons from the 1920s through the 1960s. Printed materials in the collection include: PTC, "Off-Peak" (1943-1944); PTC, "PTC News" (1949-1957), The PRT Traveler, and numerous brochures published for riders, route schedules, maps, unused books of transfers, and used transpasses other publications.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
